title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0169

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we have a great elementary level lesson all about having fun.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节关于乐趣的初级课程。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Today we are going to have a lot of fun.
segments.cn: 今天我们会玩得很开心。

segments.en: And, well, before we explain what exactly we're going to do, why don't we take a look at vocabulary preview?
segments.cn: 在我们解释具体要做什么之前，先来看看词汇预览吧？

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 词汇预览。

segments.en: Okay, so the word we're previewing today is a noun.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们预览的单词是一个名词。

segments.en: It's a thing.
segments.cn: 它是一个东西。

segments.en: It's a roller coaster.
segments.cn: 它是过山车。

segments.en: All right, a roller coaster.
segments.cn: 好的，过山车。

segments.en: So that's what we're going to do today.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们要做的就是这个。

segments.en: We're going to get on a roller coaster.
segments.cn: 我们要坐过山车。

segments.en: But what is a roller coaster?
segments.cn: 但过山车是什么呢？

segments.en: Well, a roller coaster is something that we see oftentimes in parks, amusement parks.
segments.cn: 过山车是我们在公园、游乐园常见的东西。

segments.en: And it's like a little train, but it can go upside down, and it goes very fast, and it turns, and it's supposed to make you scared and happy.
segments.cn: 它像一列小火车，但可以翻转，速度很快，还会转弯，应该让你感到害怕和快乐。

segments.en: Okay, so it goes very fast, and yet many people have probably seen it.
segments.cn: 好的，它的速度很快，很多人可能都见过。

segments.en: It goes very fast, and as you say, up and down.
segments.cn: 它速度很快，正如你所说，上下起伏。

segments.en: And, well, you just get on it because it's fun.
segments.cn: 而且，你就是因为好玩才去坐它。

segments.en: You go fast and you get scared because you're going so fast and sometimes you're going upside down.
segments.cn: 你会很快，感到害怕，因为你速度太快，有时还会翻转。

segments.en: Exactly, and for some reason, I don't know why, but in many romance languages the name is Russian mountains.
segments.cn: 没错，不知道为什么，在很多罗曼语中，它被称为俄罗斯山。

segments.en: Exactly, yeah, it's also, in Spanish it's also a Russian mountain.
segments.cn: 没错，在西班牙语中也是俄罗斯山。

segments.en: So I think the reason is because back in the day, back, you know, a hundred years ago when they were starting, the first roller coasters came from Russia.
segments.cn: 我想原因是因为在一百年前，最早的过山车来自俄罗斯。

segments.en: Oh wow, so that's why it's called... Well, that's a theory, I'm not sure, but take a listen to today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 哇，所以这就是为什么它叫……这只是一个理论，我不确定，但听听今天的对话吧。

segments.en: We'll hear it one time, and when we come back, we'll be talking about more interesting and exciting phrases and words about roller coasters.
segments.cn: 我们听一次，回来后会讨论更多有趣和激动人心的关于过山车的短语和单词。

segments.en: I'm so excited!
segments.cn: 我太兴奋了！

segments.en: We're finally here!
segments.cn: 我们终于到了！

segments.en: Six Flags Magic Mountain.
segments.cn: 六旗魔法山。

segments.en: This is the best amusement park in the world!
segments.cn: 这是世界上最好的游乐园！

segments.en: All right, settle down now.
segments.cn: 好的，安静点。

segments.en: You're gonna give yourself a heart attack.
segments.cn: 你会让自己心脏病发作的。

segments.en: I can't believe they charge us $35 each.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信他们每人收我们35美元。

segments.en: Seems like such a ripoff, don't you think?
segments.cn: 这看起来真是个骗局，你不觉得吗？

segments.en: It's not like I'm gonna get on these things.
segments.cn: 我又不是要坐这些东西。

segments.en: Whoa!
segments.cn: 哇！

segments.en: Viper!
segments.cn: 蝰蛇！

segments.en: That's the world's highest and fastest roller coaster!
segments.cn: 那是世界上最高最快的过山车！

segments.en: You go at more than 100 miles per hour.
segments.cn: 你会以超过每小时100英里的速度行驶。

segments.en: I'm gonna go on that one.
segments.cn: 我想去坐那个。

segments.en: Can I, Mom, please?
segments.cn: 妈妈，我可以吗？

segments.en: Can I?
segments.cn: 我可以吗？

segments.en: Chris, I'm not sure you should get on that.
segments.cn: Chris，我不确定你应该去坐那个。

segments.en: It seems a bit too much for you, and we've just had breakfast 30 minutes ago.
segments.cn: 对你来说似乎有点太多了，而且我们刚吃完早餐30分钟。

segments.en: I don't think it's a good idea.
segments.cn: 我觉得这不是个好主意。

segments.en: Come on, Mom, I can handle it.
segments.cn: 来吧，妈妈，我能应付的。

segments.en: I promise I won't ask for anything else.
segments.cn: 我保证我不会再要求其他的了。

segments.en: Besides, it's not like I'm gonna throw up or anything.
segments.cn: 而且，我又不是会呕吐。

segments.en: Let him go, Carol.
segments.cn: 让他去吧，Carol。

segments.en: He'll be fine.
segments.cn: 他会没事的。

segments.en: All right!
segments.cn: 好的！

segments.en: Yeah, this is amazing!
segments.cn: 是的，这太棒了！

segments.en: See how high up we're going?
segments.cn: 你看我们上得多高？

segments.en: Whoa!
segments.cn: 哇！

segments.en: All.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: right, we're back.
segments.cn: 很有趣。

segments.en: So, interesting.
segments.cn: 我觉得这很常见。

segments.en: I think this is very common.
segments.cn: 你坐上这些东西，速度太快，结果就呕吐了。

segments.en: You get on one of these things, you go so fast that you just throw up.
segments.cn: 你有没有呕吐过？

segments.en: Have you ever thrown up?
segments.cn: 在过山车上？

segments.en: On a roller coaster?
segments.cn: 没有，从来没有。

segments.en: No, never.
segments.cn: 好吧，可能这并不常见，但我们来看看在这段对话中，男孩和他的父母之间听到的一些单词。

segments.en: All right, well, maybe it's not that common, but let's take a look at some of the words that we hear in this conversation between a boy and his parents.
segments.cn: 好的，正如我们提到的这个词，呕吐，呕吐。

segments.en: All right, so as we mentioned this word, throw up, to throw up.
segments.cn: 我们先看看这个吧？

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at that one first?
segments.cn: 虽然它几乎在对话的结尾，但呕吐是什么？

segments.en: Although it's almost at the end of the dialogue, what is it, to throw up?
segments.cn: 好吧，呕吐和呕吐是不同的。

segments.en: Okay, well, to throw is different than to throw up.
segments.cn: 所以记住这两个词是一起的，意思是呕吐。

segments.en: So remember that these two words go together to mean to vomit.
segments.cn: 这意味着你胃里的东西从嘴里出来。

segments.en: That means that the things in your stomach come out your mouth.
segments.cn: 就像我们在对话中听到的那样，听起来很恶心，对吧？

segments.en: So like we heard in the dialogue, they came in like... Yeah, it's a very disgusting sound, right?
segments.cn: 所以有时人们吃得太多会呕吐，有时生病时会呕吐，有时坐过山车后会呕吐。

segments.en: And so sometimes people throw up when they eat too much, sometimes they throw up when they're sick, and sometimes they throw up after riding a roller coaster.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个重要的短语。

segments.en: And so this is an important phrase to know.
segments.cn: 或者像你在船上时，晕船呕吐。

segments.en: Or like when you're on a boat, you get seasick and you throw up.
segments.cn: 或者在车里，有时你会晕车。

segments.en: Or in a car, sometimes you get carsick.
segments.cn: 好的，正如我们提到的，我们也在游乐园。

segments.en: All right, so as we mentioned, we're also visiting an amusement park.
segments.cn: 那我们来解释一下这个词吧？

segments.en: So why don't we explain this word a little bit?
segments.cn: 游乐园。

segments.en: Amusement park.
segments.cn: 好的，首先，每个人可能都知道公园这个词，它是一个公共场所。

segments.en: Okay, first of all, everyone probably knows the word park, you know, it's a public place.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，游乐园是一个充满乐趣的公园。

segments.en: But in this case, an amusement park is a park of fun.
segments.cn: 游乐意味着乐趣。

segments.en: Amusement means fun.
segments.cn: 所以通常是你去的地方，你支付一个价格，他们给你一张票，你可以玩一整天。

segments.en: And so it's usually a place that you go to and you pay a price, and they give you a ticket, and you can play all day long.
segments.cn: 所以他们有过山车、食物和表演。

segments.en: So they have roller coasters and food and shows.
segments.cn: 所以最著名或最知名的游乐园可能是迪士尼乐园。

segments.en: So probably the most famous or well known amusement park is Disneyland.
segments.cn: 所以这就是游乐园。

segments.en: So that's an amusement park.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 这里有很多适合各个年龄段的有趣活动。

segments.en: And there's lots of fun things to do for people of all ages.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 现在孩子太兴奋了，妈妈说，好的，你会让自己心脏病发作的。

segments.en: And now the kid was so excited that the mom said, All right, you're gonna give yourself a heart attack.
segments.cn: 好吧，心脏病发作是我们之前谈到的另一个严重健康问题，呕吐是当你的心脏停止跳动，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, right.
segments.cn: 好的，没错。

segments.en: So maybe something is stuck, or there's there's some problem with your your your heart, and there's no more blood going through your heart.
segments.cn: 所以可能有什么东西卡住了，或者你的心脏有问题，血液无法流通。

segments.en: And so it's a very, very serious issue.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常非常严重的问题。

segments.en: But in this case, she's saying you're so excited, you might hurt your heart, you're gonna have a heart attack, you might hurt yourself because you're so excited, right?
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，她说你太兴奋了，可能会伤到你的心脏，你会心脏病发作，可能会因为太兴奋而受伤，对吧？

segments.en: So she's exaggerating.
segments.cn: 所以她在夸大其词。

segments.en: That's not really going to happen.
segments.cn: 这并不会真的发生。

segments.en: But she's trying to warn him.
segments.cn: 但她是在试图警告他。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And now the father mentioned that they paid $35 for each of their tickets, and he thought it was a rip off.
segments.cn: 现在父亲提到他们为每张票支付了35美元，他认为这是个骗局。

segments.en: Okay, rip off is a great, great phrase that we use in spoken English to describe something that's unfair.
segments.cn: 好吧，骗局是我们在口语中用来描述不公平的东西的一个很好的短语。

segments.en: So a price that's unfair.
segments.cn: 所以一个不公平的价格。

segments.en: Okay, so you can maybe go to the market, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，你可以去市场，对吧？

segments.en: And you ask how much a sweater is, and they'll tell you it's $100.
segments.cn: 你问一件毛衣多少钱，他们会告诉你是100美元。

segments.en: You think that's a rip off?
segments.cn: 你觉得这太贵了吗？

segments.en: What a rip off.
segments.cn: 真是太贵了。

segments.en: I can buy a sweater for $20.
segments.cn: 我可以花20美元买一件毛衣。

segments.en: So 100 is definitely a rip off.
segments.cn: 所以100绝对是太贵了。

segments.en: All right, so that's a rip off.
segments.cn: 好吧，那就是太贵了。

segments.en: It was a rip off.
segments.cn: 这确实是太贵了。

segments.en: He's not very happy with how much money he paid.
segments.cn: 他对自己花了多少钱不太满意。

segments.en: Not at all.
segments.cn: 一点也不。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And now the kid was talking about the roller coaster that is the highest and fastest roller coaster.
segments.cn: 现在孩子在谈论世界上最高和最快的过山车。

segments.en: And he said that the speed was at more than 100 miles per hour.
segments.cn: 他说速度超过每小时100英里。

segments.en: So what about this miles per hour?
segments.cn: 那么每小时的英里数呢？

segments.en: Okay, this is very important if you go to America, you'll see that the speeds on the road are all in miles per hour.
segments.cn: 好的，这在你去美国时非常重要，你会看到路上的速度都是以每小时英里为单位。

segments.en: So mile is a distance.
segments.cn: 所以英里是一个距离。

segments.en: And per hour means how many miles you can travel every hour.
segments.cn: 每小时意味着你每小时可以行驶多少英里。

segments.en: So in one hour, you can go 100 miles.
segments.cn: 所以在一个小时内，你可以走100英里。

segments.en: So we have the equivalent, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们有等价的单位，对吧？

segments.en: We have like kilometers per hour.
segments.cn: 我们有公里每小时。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And so miles per hour, kilometers per hour, these are both called speeds.
segments.cn: 所以每小时的英里数和每小时的公里数，这两者都称为速度。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And well, this is called the imperial system, right?
segments.cn: 而且，这被称为英制系统，对吧？

segments.en: You use miles, you use inches and feet, whereas the kilometers or centimeters or meters, you would use the metric system, right?
segments.cn: 你使用英里，使用英寸和英尺，而公里或厘米或米，你会使用公制系统，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly, because the counting is done by meters, meters metric.
segments.cn: 正是如此，因为计量是以米为单位，米是公制的。

segments.en: So in this case, we're in America, we know that because the speed limit is 100 miles or the speed here is 100 miles an hour.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，我们在美国，我们知道因为限速是100英里，或者这里的速度是每小时100英里。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Miles.
segments.cn: 英里。

segments.en: We know that we're in America because the speed the boys talking about is miles per hour.
segments.cn: 我们知道我们在美国，因为男孩谈论的速度是每小时英里数。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And I think yeah, use it in North America.
segments.cn: 我想是的，在北美使用。

segments.en: And that's pretty much it, right?
segments.cn: 这差不多就是了，对吧？

segments.en: I think they use miles in Britain.
segments.cn: 我想他们在英国也使用英里。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I'm not positive.
segments.cn: 是的，我不太确定。

segments.en: I'd have to check with my British friends.
segments.cn: 我得问问我的英国朋友。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Okay, so that's all the words we have for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们为语言学习准备的所有词汇。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue again, and we'll be back to explain some phrases.
segments.cn: 让我们再听一遍对话，然后我们会回来解释一些短语。

segments.en: I'm so excited.
segments.cn: 我太兴奋了。

segments.en: We're finally here.
segments.cn: 我们终于到了。

segments.en: Six Flags Magic Mountain.
segments.cn: 六旗魔术山。

segments.en: This is the best amusement park in the world.
segments.cn: 这是世界上最好的游乐园。

segments.en: All right, settle down now.
segments.cn: 好吧，安静下来。

segments.en: You're going to give yourself a heart attack.
segments.cn: 你会让自己心脏病发作的。

segments.en: I can't believe they charge us $35 each.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信他们每人收我们35美元。

segments.en: It seems like such a rip off, don't you think?
segments.cn: 这看起来真是太贵了，你不觉得吗？

segments.en: It's not like I'm going to get on these things.
segments.cn: 这不是说我会去玩这些东西。

segments.en: Whoa, Viper.
segments.cn: 哇，毒蛇。

segments.en: That's the world's highest and fastest roller coaster.
segments.cn: 那是世界上最高和最快的过山车。

segments.en: You go at more than 100 miles per hour.
segments.cn: 你会以超过每小时100英里的速度行驶。

segments.en: I want to go on that one.
segments.cn: 我想去那个。

segments.en: Can I, Mom, please?
segments.cn: 妈妈，我可以吗？

segments.en: Can I?
segments.cn: 我可以吗？

segments.en: Chris, I'm not sure you should get on that.
segments.cn: 克里斯，我不确定你应该上那个。

segments.en: It seems a bit too much for you, and we've just had breakfast 30 minutes ago.
segments.cn: 这对你来说似乎有点太多了，而且我们刚刚在30分钟前吃过早餐。

segments.en: I don't think it's a good idea.
segments.cn: 我觉得这不是个好主意。

segments.en: Come on, Mom.
segments.cn: 来吧，妈妈。

segments.en: I can handle it.
segments.cn: 我能应付的。

segments.en: I promise I won't ask for anything else.
segments.cn: 我保证我不会再要求其他东西。

segments.en: Besides, it's not like I'm going to throw up or anything.
segments.cn: 而且，我不会呕吐或什么的。

segments.en: Let him go, Carol.
segments.cn: 让他去吧，卡罗尔。

segments.en: He'll be fine.
segments.cn: 他会没事的。

segments.en: All right!
segments.cn: 好吧！

segments.en: Yeah, this is amazing!
segments.cn: 是的，这太棒了！

segments.en: See how high up we're going?
segments.cn: 你看我们上得多高？

segments.en: All right, we're back, so now why don't we start with three phrases that we have prepared for you today in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了，现在我们为什么不开始今天在流利构建器中准备的三个短语呢？

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利构建器。

segments.en: Okay, this first phrase, Marco, is definitely a parent phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，这第一个短语，马尔科，绝对是一个父母的短语。

segments.en: Okay, so this is something that you often hear parents sing to their children.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一种你经常听到父母对孩子说的。

segments.en: They say, settle down now.
segments.cn: 他们说，安静下来。

segments.en: Settle down now.
segments.cn: 安静下来。

segments.en: Teachers say this too, yeah.
segments.cn: 老师也会这样说，是的。

segments.en: All right, everyone, settle down.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，安静下来。

segments.en: That means if I'm really excited and I want to talk and I'm running around the room and my teacher says, settle down now, that means quiet down, go slowly, sit down, don't talk.
segments.cn: 这意味着如果我真的很兴奋，想要说话，跑来跑去，而我的老师说，安静下来，那就意味着安静下来，慢慢来，坐下，不要说话。

segments.en: It means calm down.
segments.cn: 这意味着冷静下来。

segments.en: Calm down, yeah.
segments.cn: 冷静下来，是的。

segments.en: So to calm down, to relax.
segments.cn: 所以冷静下来，放松。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Settle down.
segments.cn: 安静下来。

segments.en: All right, and now the next phrase is a very kids phrase, I think, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，接下来的短语是一个非常适合孩子的短语，我认为，对吧？

segments.en: That you would use on your parents.
segments.cn: 你会用在父母身上。

segments.en: So if they say, no, you can't go to your friend's house.
segments.cn: 所以如果他们说，不，你不能去你朋友家。

segments.en: You, oh, come on, please.
segments.cn: 你，哦，拜托。

segments.en: Oh, mom, come on.
segments.cn: 哦，妈妈，拜托。

segments.en: All right, so what do you mean with that phrase?
segments.cn: 好吧，那么这个短语是什么意思？

segments.en: What come on, come on, what?
segments.cn: 拜托，拜托，什么？

segments.en: So in this, we have a child who's asking something.
segments.cn: 所以在这里，我们有一个孩子在请求某事。

segments.en: He's saying, can you please let me do something?
segments.cn: 他在说，你能让我做点什么吗？

segments.en: Please come on.
segments.cn: 拜托，拜托。

segments.en: That means I'm, I'm encouraging you to change your mind or to let me do something.
segments.cn: 这意味着我在鼓励你改变主意或让我做某事。

segments.en: So please let me have my way.
segments.cn: 所以请让我如愿以偿。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，没错。

segments.en: All right, so come on.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以拜托。

segments.en: And you don't only use it as a child or with your parents, right?
segments.cn: 你不仅仅在孩子或父母面前使用它，对吧？

segments.en: You can encourage your friends to like, come on, come with me to the bar, come on.
segments.cn: 你可以鼓励你的朋友，比如，来吧，跟我去酒吧，来吧。

segments.en: Come on, let's go.
segments.cn: 来吧，我们走。

segments.en: Come on.
segments.cn: 来吧。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: You want to.
segments.cn: 你想要。

segments.en: And our last phrase, I can handle it.
segments.cn: 我们最后一句话，我能应付。

segments.en: Okay, this is next to the phrase, oh, come on.
segments.cn: 好的，这句旁边是，哦，来吧。

segments.en: So the boy is trying to explain that he's big enough and old enough to go on a rollercoaster, but his mother doesn't know.
segments.cn: 所以这个男孩试图解释他足够大，足够老可以去坐过山车，但他妈妈不知道。

segments.en: She says, oh, I don't know, you know, you're too young.
segments.cn: 她说，哦，我不知道，你知道，你太年轻了。

segments.en: And so he says, I can handle it.
segments.cn: 所以他说，我能应付。

segments.en: That means I am big enough and old enough to go on a rollercoaster.
segments.cn: 这意味着我足够大，足够老可以去坐过山车。

segments.en: I won't have a problem.
segments.cn: 我不会有问题。

segments.en: So you can do it, right?
segments.cn: 所以你可以做到，对吧？

segments.en: Basically, I am good enough to do it.
segments.cn: 基本上，我足够好可以做到。

segments.en: So, for example, if I give you a very hard project, you can say, I can handle it.
segments.cn: 所以，例如，如果我给你一个非常困难的项目，你可以说，我能应付。

segments.en: I can do it.
segments.cn: 我可以做到。

segments.en: You could also say, I'm very busy right now.
segments.cn: 你也可以说，我现在很忙。

segments.en: I can't handle it.
segments.cn: 我不能应付。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: I can't, I can't do it.
segments.cn: 我不能，我不能做到。

segments.en: I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 对不起。

segments.en: I can't do it.
segments.cn: 我不能做到。

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: Interesting phrases there.
segments.cn: 有趣的短语。

segments.en: They're very useful and very, very common in spoken English in North America and, well, a lot of places.
segments.cn: 它们在北美的口语英语中非常有用且非常常见，嗯，很多地方。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to the dialogue for the third time and we'll be back.
segments.cn: 所以我们为什么不再听第三次对话，我们会回来。

segments.en: I'm so excited.
segments.cn: 我太兴奋了。

segments.en: We're finally here.
segments.cn: 我们终于到了。

segments.en: Six Flags Magic Mountain.
segments.cn: 六旗魔术山。

segments.en: This is the best amusement park in the world.
segments.cn: 这是世界上最好的游乐园。

segments.en: All right, settle down now.
segments.cn: 好吧，安静下来。

segments.en: You're going to give yourself a heart attack.
segments.cn: 你会让自己心脏病发作的。

segments.en: I can't believe they charge us $35 each.
segments.cn: 我简直不敢相信他们每人收我们35美元。

segments.en: Seems like such a rip-off, don't you think?
segments.cn: 这看起来真是个骗局，你不觉得吗？

segments.en: It's not like I'm going to get on these things.
segments.cn: 我又不是要坐这些东西。

segments.en: Whoa.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: Viper.
segments.cn: 蝰蛇。

segments.en: That's the world's highest and fastest roller coaster.
segments.cn: 那是世界上最高最快的过山车。

segments.en: You go at more than 100 miles per hour.
segments.cn: 你以超过每小时100英里的速度行驶。

segments.en: I want to go on that one.
segments.cn: 我想坐那个。

segments.en: Can I, mom, please?
segments.cn: 妈妈，我可以吗？

segments.en: Can I?
segments.cn: 我可以吗？

segments.en: Chris, I'm not sure you should get on that.
segments.cn: 克里斯，我不确定你应该坐那个。

segments.en: It seems a bit too much for you.
segments.cn: 这对你来说似乎有点过分。

segments.en: And we just had breakfast 30 minutes ago.
segments.cn: 而且我们刚刚在30分钟前吃过早餐。

segments.en: I don't think it's a good idea.
segments.cn: 我觉得这不是个好主意。

segments.en: Come on, mom.
segments.cn: 来吧，妈妈。

segments.en: I can handle it.
segments.cn: 我能应付。

segments.en: I promise I won't ask for anything else.
segments.cn: 我保证我不会再要求其他东西。

segments.en: Besides, it's not like I'm going to throw up or anything.
segments.cn: 而且，我又不是要呕吐什么的。

segments.en: Let him go, Carol.
segments.cn: 让他去吧，卡罗尔。

segments.en: He'll be fine.
segments.cn: 他会没事的。

segments.en: All right!
segments.cn: 好吧！

segments.en: Yeah, this is amazing!
segments.cn: 是的，这太棒了！

segments.en: See how high up we're going?
segments.cn: 你看我们有多高？

segments.en: All right, so this amusement park, Magic Mountain, it actually exists in the United States, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这个游乐园，魔术山，实际上在美国存在，对吧？

segments.en: It does, and Six Flags is really a brand, so there are many different parks, amusement parks called Six Flags, and each one has a different name.
segments.cn: 是的，六旗确实是一个品牌，所以有很多不同的游乐园叫六旗，每个都有不同的名字。

segments.en: I'm not sure where Magic Mountain is, but... That one's in California.
segments.cn: 我不确定魔术山在哪里，但……那个在加利福尼亚。

segments.en: Then you have Six Flags Greater America.
segments.cn: 然后你有六旗大美国。

segments.en: Yeah, that's my Chicago Six Flags.
segments.cn: 是的，那是我在芝加哥的六旗。

segments.en: So they're basically amusement parks, and they're famous because they have really great or intense roller coasters, right?
segments.cn: 所以它们基本上是游乐园，它们因拥有非常棒或刺激的过山车而闻名，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So the one that we heard about in today's dialogue is called Viper, like the snake, and that one is at the amusement park in California you mentioned.
segments.cn: 所以我们今天对话中提到的那个叫蝰蛇，就像蛇一样，那个在你提到的加利福尼亚的游乐园。

segments.en: But the famous ride in Chicago is Batman the Ride.
segments.cn: 但芝加哥著名的游乐设施是蝙蝠侠之旅。

segments.en: Oh,
segments.cn: 哦，

segments.en: and it's very fast, and you don't actually sit on a train, right?
segments.cn: 而且它非常快，你实际上并不是坐在火车上，对吧？

segments.en: The track is on top of your head.
segments.cn: 轨道在你头顶上。

segments.en: Exactly, so you're hanging.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以你是悬挂着的。

segments.en: So you see everyone downstairs.
segments.cn: 所以你可以看到下面的每个人。

segments.en: Well, not downstairs, down at the bottom.
segments.cn: 嗯，不是下面，是在底部。

segments.en: And I hear they have a very serious problem with people losing their shoes.
segments.cn: 我听说他们有一个非常严重的问题，就是人们丢失鞋子。

segments.en: I heard about this, people wearing sandals and they just fly off.
segments.cn: 我听说过这个，人们穿着凉鞋，它们就飞掉了。

segments.en: Exactly, so I want to warn everyone, if you go to Chicago or you go to these upside down, these flipped roller coasters, you should bring real shoes, not sandals.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以我想警告大家，如果你去芝加哥或者去这些倒置的、翻转的过山车，你应该穿真正的鞋子，而不是凉鞋。

segments.en: Well, as we mentioned, in many languages, in the Romance languages, they're called Russian mountains.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如我们提到的，在许多语言中，在罗曼语系中，它们被称为俄罗斯山。

segments.en: So I wonder, for our Russian listeners, do you have any intense or great roller coasters in Russia?
segments.cn: 所以我想知道，对于我们的俄罗斯听众，你们在俄罗斯有任何刺激或伟大的过山车吗？

segments.en: I mean, if they come from Russia, they should have amazing roller coasters there, right?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，如果它们来自俄罗斯，那里的过山车应该很棒，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Or do you have any idea why we call them Russian mountains in other languages?
segments.cn: 或者你知道为什么我们在其他语言中称它们为俄罗斯山吗？

segments.en: Please let us know.
segments.cn: 请告诉我们。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: We also welcome your questions and comments on other issues.
segments.cn: 我们也欢迎你对其他问题的提问和评论。

segments.en: So until next time, everyone.
segments.cn: 所以下次见，大家。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
